description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

ATAP is a fast-paced, project-focused innovation group. Projects are developed and executed at the intersection of ambitious science and an urgent user need, or application. You will be working on Project Soli, Project Jacquard and other projects that are within ATAP.

You are a Technical Program Manager who will define and drive test/Quality Assurance programs for Project Jacquard and Soli. The software system includes firmware running on embedded devices, machine learning pipelines, mobile apps on iOS and Android, as well as web services running in the cloud.

You will play a critical role in managing risk and directing product launches, with a focus on the quality and reliability of the product. You will use your knowledge and past experience to influence better product design, promote proper engineering practices, enhance testability and accessibility, and apply other advanced quality concepts across products. Through your leadership and professional expertise, you will build, lead and manage teams, set testing and quality goals, and lead the overall strategy for the group of test engineers. You will also identify, build and nurture necessary partnerships with internal and external stakeholders to further improve the quality of the ecosystem. You will leverage your experience to help us ship high quality products (and eventually, platforms).

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of program management experience. Experience in systems development life cycle and QA methodologies.
  • Experience in driving programs through launch as well as post-launch maintenance.
  • Experience coordinating teams in testing mobile apps (iOS and/ or Android), and/or web services running in the backend.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in coordinating the work of teams distributed across geographies.
  • Experience in coordinating the validation of end-to-end products: a combination of firmware, mobile apps and cloud services.
  • Experience with device connectivity (Bluetooth/Bluetooth Low Energy), touch technologies or radar technologies.
responsibilities:
• Drive QA teams to define and execute the test strategy for firmware, mobile apps and backend components to deliver end-to-end product validation.
  • Improve velocity of work across the team by developing strategies to build and validate prototypes with a lightweight process that supports agile development.
  • Identify and communicate project risks (schedule/resource, etc.); develop and coordinate strategies to mitigate these risks.
  • Communicate project status and changes across the team to ensure that teams are aligned with the project plan at all times.
  • Manage a team of QA engineers to oversee, build and deliver a thorough manual execution plan.
title: Technical Program Manager, ATAP
